channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description:
@espiers @delong I think we should accept that they don’t want one, and admit that @Sulliview’s idea of good journalism isn’t compatible with his thr Times understands its business model.
@espiers @delong @Sulliview Probably worth digging up the old critiques of mainstream media offered in the 60s in the Alternative Press and repurposing them.
@prof_dainy It’s not on their feed. And they have better design sense than this.
@FeldheimRejects So a sequel to this? https://t.co/hO8AsfPpf0
In which I try to one-up @ManischewitzCo https://t.co/vEdgbQLmia
@MisfitTorah @typolad Nobody talks about the time that Rav Moshe made a deal with Jimmy Carter to support Big Peanut in exchange for favorable Pell grant regulations.
@jamesdnicoll Isn’t approaching from an idiosyncratic angle central to the male reproductive system? So yes.
@typolad In the paper this week so challenge @ManischewitzCo to Big Mac macaroons.
@onthemainline Conversely: More Jews today have heard of that text than ever before in Jewish history.
@onthemainline Has anything been written on the genre?
@onthemainline @hannahofhameln Particularly the baby. Kids that age have no self control when it comes to secrets.
@onthemainline Sounds Ashkenonormative, but OK.
@onthemainline I’d love to hear your argument for this one.
@trekonomics Horrible.
@kampeas Where’s Rishi’s Rashi when you need him?
@trekonomics Funny how quiet a certain crop of “Democratic” entertainment billionaires have been of late.
@ZachWeiner They’re all sequels to Star Wars, which happened “a long time ago.”
@UrbanJerseyGuy @davidlovesmaps @jahorne But a subway line on the GWB would connect them.
@yitzlandes Route Four Jersey line across the GWB or go home.
@datadivajf Can’t a man do teshuva?
@datadivajf I’ve sampled worse Mountain Dew flavors.
@scalzi As someone no longer as eager to read serious war stories as I was when the Forever War came out, this is a strong pitch for me to read OMW.

@kampeas (((George Gershwin)))
@kampeas Rhapsody in (((Blue)))
@paulrfoth @WillCarterII @adam_a_perez It could be yours for the proverbial song. Sadly, I can’t make out the table of contents. https://t.co/q3UFp9mY3n
